hook.text: Centrists get called wishy-washy by both sides. But the political center is where most voters live.

buildup.text: Centrism seeks a middle ground between left and right. It favors pragmatic compromise over ideology.

discovery.text: Tony Blair's Third Way and Macron's En Marche both claimed the center. They mixed left and right ideas.

twist.text: Critics say centrism is just defending the status quo. When the system is broken, moderation isn't a virtue.

climax.text: In polarized times, the center shrinks. Voters move to extremes and centrists lose elections.

punchline.text: The center sounds reasonable. But it's hard to inspire passion with 'maybe.'

quiz.question: What is the main criticism of centrism?
options: It defends the status quo when the system may need fundamental change
It is too radical for most voters
It only exists in European politics
